Reviews.Content: Romantic step back in time We stayed here on our wedding night. I'd wanted to stay in an old-fashioned Victorian place, and that's just what I got. The room was beautiful, if slightly run-down at the edges when you looked too closely. I felt like I'd stepped back in time, and it was perfect for a wedding night - romantic and cozy and easy to forget the world outside. We didn't eat there, so I can't speak to the food. The price was a bit dear for our budgets at the time, but a splurge at the time. The price does seem a little steep, maybe, but it is a unique sort of accommodation and you are paying for the historical experience as well as comfort, etc. We loved the breakfast delivered to our room, that we could enjoy by the window. All in all, a lovely splurge experience.
Reviews.Author: gurgaveed

Reviews.Content: very nice! My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. We've stayed in a lot of places in San Francisco, and this place was a nice change of pace. The outside is beautiful and just down the street is the famous Painted Ladies and across the street is Alamo Square Park. There was a free parking lot and limited parking available in the street. I think that is due to the fact that the location of this hotel is more residential than touristy. The only complaint was that every place we went required a taxi (the staff would call one for us and was very accomodating), but then again, we knew it was an out of the way hotel which was kind of why we stayed there. The lobby had a little bit of a funky smell, but what do you expect from a place thats as old as this! The rooms were wonderful! Very quaint...small tv, HUGE fireplace. The beds were comfortable, a very good complimentary breakfast in our room, great decor, and the service was FANTASTIC! We were given wonderful advice by the manager about restaurants, wineries, night clubs, or just interesting things to do in the city. We were looking for a nice, quiet, romantic place to spend our honeymoon and I think we made the absolute right choice! I know they are renovating soon and I can hardly wait to stay in the new and improved Archbishops Mansion!
Reviews.Author: JVKoe

Reviews.Content: A different experience I've always wanted to stay in a creepy mansion-type place and this place was perfect. However, I'm a big wussy and get scared easily. This place was scary, and it didn't help that I checked in at night. They have one clerk on duty in a study right beside the front door. They are pretty friendly people.We stayed in one of the Romeo and Juliet rooms on the first floor. The bathroom was huge and had a jet tub (I don't think they cleaned it very well though. They definitely didn't clean it while we were out the next day--we stayed 2 nights) It is an old house and it shows. Their bed linens are starting to wear thin and had a musty smell to it.Good points: The rooms are all distinct and they leave the doors open if they are unoccupied so you can roam around and look. Apparently they have a wine and cheese every night for guests to socialize but who wants to do that?I liked the breakfast in bed. You get a card that you tick off what you want for breakfast the next day and what time for them to bring it and hang it outside your door. The quiche is very yummy! Just continental breakfast basically but pretty nice.There is about 5 or 6 parking spots and you can park on the street.
Reviews.Author: pika_sil

Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Stayed in the Rosenkavalier- very cold room, lumpy/bouncy bed (but the bedding was fair), large bathroom, but small toilet space (coffin like)...it was shabby 1890's meets 1970...strange. The in-room library had a few classics (Milton, Shakespeare, Stendhal), a pleasant surprise.My husband and I may stay again after the renovation.Maybe.
Reviews.Author: yvettev

Reviews.Content: Amazing except for the menu... My wife and I decided that we would visit San Francisco for our honeymoon and found the Archbishop recommended in several travel books and decided that it would be a great place to spend three nights.The Archbishop operates like a bed and breakfast and is extremely unique. Breakfast is delivered to your room each morning along with the pastry cart from which you can make a selection. Our room was tastefully decorated and very cozy. The hotel supplies top of the line toiletries (mint shampoo and body cream). Our bed was very comfortable and was topped by a thick douvet and pillows that were actually pillows (a pet peeve of ours). The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is located close to transit on a road frequented regularly by taxis so hailing one is never an issue. This hotel has a very small elevator which would only fit one or two people comfortably, otherwise you will need to climb potentially several flights of stairs depending on the location of your room. This was not a conern for us so we did not address this at the time of booking, so it is possible that those with limited mobility may be accomodated. Be sure to raise this concern if it applies.One of the best features of the Archbishop is that they offer a complimentary wine and cheese get together for the guests to enjoy each evening before dinner. There are several cheeses and wine to sample and this serves as an excellent opportunity to discuss your day with fellow guests and get new ideas for the next day.The only negative thing that I could say about the Archbishop is that in my opinion, a bed and breakfast should change their menu daily and not offer the same thing twice. All three mornings we were offered the same quiche (spinach or ham) which was nice on the first morning but we had grown very tired of it by the third morning. Based on the fact that the rates are mid-luxury, this ought to be addressed - also given that my wife is not an egg eater, her choices were far more limited.All in all, we would recommend the Archbishop and would likely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Mansion My wife and I stayed at the Archbishop's Mansion for three days and found it to be marvelous. The magnificent building and ornate furnishings are an absolute treasure. The staff (Melanie, Jamir, and the wonderful lady who prepared such a delightful breakfast) were enthusiastic about sharing their local knowledge and ensured their guests were aware of all options in relation to things to do etc. We were on the road for five months and to finish our adventure at the Archbishop's Mansion was nothing short of Fantastic!!We will certainly return for another visit and recommend it without reservation.Keep up the great work guys and gals.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Neat place, but definitely not worth the price. This is the kind of place you really want to love, but can't. Cool old building, but the rooms smell musty and moldy --and they are. You pay over $200 a night and get a television smaller than a portable radio and which was made in 1960 and looked like it fell off the back of a truck. And breakfast consists of REALLY old, store bought pastries and granola. Service is also pretty terrible: takes forever to pay for the room and the parking provided consists of six really tight spots for over a dozen rooms.That said, loved the neighborhood and some of the rooms are spacious with nice views. Place would be great for $100 to $120 a night; at $200 and up, I would not go back.
Reviews.Author: Mendobabe

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a beautiful week at The Mansion We recently enjoyed a wonderful week's stay at Archbishop's Mansion. Had been recommended by a friend and it exceeded our expectations. We actually stayed in two rooms during the week - Madame Butterfly and Der Rosencavelier - both were beautiful! Staff was outstanding (spoke with Melanie most often - she was fabulous!)- but each one was very friendly and helpful with directions, guidance and recommendations for dining, sightseeing, etc. The Inn was immaculate, very quiet and the wine and cheese reception in the evenings was a nice amenity. Wished we could have stayed even longer - we were celebrating our 29th wedding anniversary and it was certainly memorable for us. Is a little out of the way as far as tourist stuff (Union Square, Wharf, etc.) but to have the peace and quiet of this residential/Alamo Square area was worth it. Hope to visit again someday! We highly recommend The Mansion!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Different Kind of Experience We just stayed at the Archbishop's Mansion and had a wonderful time. Staff friendly and helpful. The hotel had a BB flavor; however, you did not have to participate in the guest activities if you did not want to. We really enjoyed the history and beauty of the hotel (some renovations are needed, but nothing that detracted from the stay). La Tosca Room was large and had hardwood flooring, large bathroom, seating area, and a wonderful fireplace. The area was very quite and nice. We had a car and simply drove to the Tourist area (maybe about a 10 minute drive). For something different than the run of the mill hotels, stay at the Archbishop's Mansion.
Reviews.Author: CMSKAK

Reviews.Content: Just OK I just stayed at the Archbishop's Mansion in SF. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. This is a bed and breakfast and the breakfast was a joke; it consisted of toast, coffee and jam. You can have a hard boiled egg if you wanted it and a glass of milk. The rooms were very different. First of all, most of the rooms I walked by were very nice looking (old, bed and breakfast style). Our room... pretty lame! The bed was very small and pretty uncomfortable. The room was not kept up very well.The location is far away from everything and a costly cab ride everytime you want dinner. Really, there's nothing to do anywhere near the place. All in all, not very impressed and wouldn't stay there again. There are plenty of other choices! Thanks!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I left my heart at the Archbishop's Mansion! Whoever coined the legendary term - being waited on hand and foot - must have stayed a couple of nights at the Archbishop's Mansion. *Disclaimer: pardon the extreme corniness, but that's the best way to describe the place. It all began when I gave my girlfriend a Christmas gift to San Francisco. We stayed in Union Square the first two nights, then I picked out the Archbishop's Mansion for the remaining three nights. The plan was to spend the touristy days in the city itself, then experience the other side of San Fran in a more intimate setting.We could not have picked such a better place than the Mansion. Just walking in the foyer to check-in makes you feel that you are walking into a piece of early 20th century. The front person then gives you a tour of the Mansion upon arrival. Luckily, we got to have a cheap upgrade to one of the most magnificient rooms in the whole mansion - the Don Giovanni suite. This suite was out of this world! I do not know if I will ever in my life sleep on a $750,000 bed where the archbishop himself may have slept. Needless to say, it was not only beautiful, but very comfortable. There was a cozy fireplace, along with a wonderful bathroom complete with seven shower heads! Connected to the room was a grand living room-like parlor with its own fireplace and antique leather chairs. The breakfast was nice in the morning...however, if you are anything like my girlfriend and I, it was more like a wake-up snack. Nevertheless, it made us feel welcome in the mansion as we awoke from our deep slumber.Speaking of welcome, the service itself is first-rate! There is usually one person stationed in the front who operates as a jack-of-all-trades. I felt that they were genuinely interested in what we wanted to do in San Fran, and what places we would most likely enjoy. Incredibly, they would take care of ALL of our needs, from making making dinner reservations to bringing us hot tea. It was the best service I have ever encountered in any setting. A great story is needed here: my girlfriend and I are rabid Steeler fans, as is one of the staff members. After the Steelers dealt a fatal blow to the Bengals' playoff hopes, we were given a little suprise in our room: complimentary sparkling wine. I was in awe, in shock, and speechless at the generous gesture the staff at the Mansion did. Words of advice: if you are looking to stay in San Fran and experience the city, you are probably better off staying in the city itself. However, if you don't mind spending a little extra money on cabfare or a rental, it would be imperative to stay at the Mansion. I know for my girlfriend and I it added immensely to our overall experience and fondness for San Fran.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Mansion is far fetched.... My Husband and I stayed at the Archbishop's Mansion for 4 days on the second leg of our honeymoon. The Mansion itself, was very beautiful. The parlor area was nice, as was the dinning area and staircase. However, the rooms were not exceptional, especially for the price. First of all, the staff was very nice, very helpful for the most part. They seemed to take a genuine interest in what you had planned for the day/evening and if they could be of any help. And, especially if you are not from that area, make sure you ask THEM for directions and do not rely on YOUR map skills!!!The rooms were nice, but not exceptional. They, of course, were decorated in period antiques, however, I did not expect the bed to be part of the period antiques. You could probably get a better nights sleep on the floor, rather than these beds!!!! I prefer a softer bed, my husband prefers a firmer bed, either way, we had back problems from sleeping in these beds. They were too harsh for either of us!! I agree with other reviews in that the rooms needed updated. Not updated to the point you lose the feel of the Mansion, but updated to the point where wallpaper is not falling off the walls and the ceilings have been FULLY repaired.As far as the breakfast in bed, the first day it was nice, by the fourth, we were screaming for anything else, but the breakfast. Be prepared, the menu does not change from day to day. Room service consists of granola, somewhat fresh fruit, warm milk, strong coffee (even if you order the light roast), Yoplait yogurt (strawberry flavor only), store bought croissants, dry toast, etc. etc. Personally, I'm thinking, ok, a Mansion, well if we have ice for their wine, then surely they have kitchen facilities to cook?? Apparently this is not so. And don't always count on your order being correct, even if you did place it the night before!!Wine and cheese receptions were nice, but apparently, my husband and I were not the type of clientele they had in mind. WE were visiting San Fran for our honeymoon, I believe the other guests staying there were there for a nice little place to stop in and sleep and drop $250 for the room. In other words, seemed to me, most of the clientele were a little pretentious and snobbish.The area of town was not so great. I didn't feel comfortable at all in the area. I'm not sure if it was the weather (it rained the whole time), the Mansion, the side of town, what we were expecting, who knows? But we did not have that great of a time in San Fran. Like I said, it was nice, but I would not go back to the Mansion to stay again. I suppose we would have been alot happier closer to the action, especially considering we were there for four days. I'm willing to give San Francisco another try, but not the Archbishop's Mansion, especially at those prices. We had a lot better time, at a much more reasonable BB, where the menu did change, the wine and cheese receptions were longer and a lot more laid back in Santa Cruz!!!Overall, if I had to give this place a grade I would give it a C-.
Reviews.Author: Lawturtle

Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, fun place to stay, nice and quiet       The upstairs hallway
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Charming with Excellent Service, but Upgrades Needed We stayed at The Archbishop's Mansion for a weekend in October to celebrate a landmark birthday. It was a first trip to San Francisco, and I wanted to choose a place that was unique, special and memorable that my partner would always remember.We were booked into the Cosi fan Tutte suite, which disappointed me at first, as my preferences were for the Carmen or Gyspy Baron suites. However, after checking into the suite (and checking out the other two -- vacant rooms are usually left open for guests to inspect), I was very pleased with what we were given. It is a large, well-laid-out three room suite, decorated in Victorian antiques and prints. There are tall, bright windows (a charming window seat in one for reading), unique french doors separating the bedroom from the living room, a marble fireplace, a walk-in cedar closet, and a large bathroom. The room is furnished mostly in Victorian antiques.The dusty rose carpet, chintz curtains and striped wallpaper have a certain shabby-chic charm, but they are beginning to show signs of wear. Some of the upholstered pieces in the room definitely need redoing as well. The bathroom is not too attractive, with chipped floor tiles and a pretty basic tub/shower combination. I think Joie de Vivre should invest some money in the property and redo all of the carpeting, wall treatments and upholstery - perhaps in whites and neutrals -to give the property a more modern flair and to better showcase all of the impressive wood. However, I'm sure some people like it just the way it is.The Mansion is more like a very upscale bed and breakfast than a boutique hotel. There are only 15 rooms, and the staff (especially Heather and John) offer warm, friendly, personalized service. They really will go out of their way to fulfill a request or to make your stay more comfortable. The wine and cheese reception in the evening was a very nice touch, and the complimentary continental breakfast served to your room in the morning was of excellent quality. I am surprised, though, in a property so small that there is no evening turndown service.I'm not sure if we would stay at The Archbishop's Mansion on our next visit to San Francisco, though, just because it is not in a very convenient location, and for the price I think I would spend just a little more and stay at the Mandarin Oriental, the Ritz or the Clift. Still, it's a unique experience that you would have difficultly duplicating anywhere else!
Reviews.Author: mykel67

Reviews.Content: B Wonderful mix of hotel services (private bath, room service bkfst, staffed office, parking) with inn/BB feel. The price - $149/179 for a non-suite - can't be beat in San Fran. Location is a bit off the beaten path from the tourist center and Fisherman's Wharf, but nice and quiet. We really enjoyed each morning's room service breakfast and the evening wine and cheese reception too.
Reviews.Author: none07

Reviews.Content: Warm, welcoming and romantic Just came back from a 4 night stay and had to post this review immediately. Let's get the only possible negative out of the way immediately - location. If you are looking for something that is in the heart of the action then look for something around Union Square. The Archbishop's Mansion is centrally located so that you can walk to Haight Ashbury (20 minutes) or Union Square (30 minutes) but if not walking then count on a $12-15 taxi or the #5 bus, which is a block away. For those looking for an escape then the location could even be a plus.The mansion's rooms are all roomy, beautifully decorated and come with functioning fireplaces and one log per day. Our room didn't have a bath (nice clean shower stall with ample hot water and pressure - remember the Mansion is 100 years old).The hotel includes a terrific room service breakfast that is delivered at the time of your choice - great coffee, fresh - OJ / bread / fruit and granola. From 6 -7pm there is a complimentary wine  cheese in the main sitting room so make sure that your dinner reservations allow you to indulge. It is an opportunity to meet some really interesting and friendly people - or keep to yourselves if you prefer.Maybe the most positive aspect of the Mansion is the staff who went out of their way to accomodate our every wish. They also have a terrific knowledge of the city. If you want a world class hotel then there are plenty of choices among the typical chains. If you want a fabulous experience and to be treated like you re special then the Archbishop's Mansion should be a strong consideration. We would definitely stay there again but with only 15 rooms and a strong repeat clientele I'd be sure to plan my stay at the Mansion well in advance.
Reviews.Author: Katesr

Reviews.Content: Great visit Lovely last night SF. stay. Room as grand as you might want. Beautiful high ceilings, fireplace, corner room, breakfast delivery to the room at time requested, free parking. Would highly recommend for thay special one night stay.
Reviews.Author: AaronFWA

Reviews.Content: A dream come true What a dream to stay at the Mansion. We were treated like a king and queen. The only draw back was the fact that we had to leave and return to the real world. The staff treated us like we were their only guest and were extremely helpful.
Reviews.Author: RaginCajun1

Reviews.Content: Beautiful house, unfriendly manager, creepy Well I wouldn't recommend this place. We found the manager to be rude, the neighborhood to be a bit too rough for our liking, and the room to be creepy. We stayed for quite a few days on a business trip and really didn't get a good nights sleep once. I kept feeling like someone was standing behind me the entire stay there, and no one was. The only interesting thing about the stay was I convinced someone to give me a tour after most of the guests had checked out and I got a look at all of the other rooms. She told me some creepy stories about the place and that added some intrigue to the experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Top marks for service and surroundings I am sitting in the Mansion right now writing this review in their brand new Business Center. They are wiring the building for wireless high speed right now. This is our second visit and I can't speak highly enough of the extremely capable, knowledgable and friendly staff, especially John, the Manager. I expect that some of the previous comments on TripAdvisor that have painted the manager in a negative light must have been mistakenly referring to Mark, the morning host. He can be a bit terse at times, but only if the guests themselves are snooty! :) We have spent quite a lot of time chatting with all or most of the staff, and they are like family! The rooms are exceptional, unlike any others in San Francisco. Folks have already mentioned the free parking (wow!), breakfast in bed, wine social hour, fireplaces, etc., etc. And now that they're getting Wi-Fi there is NO reason to stay anywhere else!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay anywhere else in SF! This place is the best. We stayed at the Hotel Rex for three nights and then four nights here. My boyfriend propsed halfway into the trip. He had the ring sent to the Rex but it didn't show up until we were already at the Mansion. The staff there are wonderful ---they went to the Rex and picked up the ring and I had no idea what was going on! The Rex on the other hand kept mentioning a package we were expecting everytime we were at the desk making me very suspicious!! We stayed in La Tosca and it was so romantic and beautiful. You just can't beat free parking, free in-room breakfast, free wine and cheese in the evenings and the size of the room in SF! We will stay there everytime! If you are looking to stay away from the touristy areas of the Wharf and Union Square, this place is it. You can get anywhere using the bus and the staff will help you. And if you plan to rent a car for at least part of your stay, the parking there is awesome. You will save so much money and time on that alone.
Reviews.Author: jen1234

Reviews.Content: Historical Charm We stayed at the Mansion on our wedding night. Since we live in the city, we were looking for something a little more unique than a highrise hotel.The hotel has been restored to turn of the century grandure. This is an old building with old frunishings. If you are accustomed to A/C, room service and spotless conditions then don't stay here. If you want a romantic, relaxing, quiet experience in a 100 year old cozy, historical setting (and money is not an issue) then please stay here.Jack  GeorgiaSan Francisco
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Beautiful property; great location; free parking My partner and I just returned from a 4-night stay at the Archbishop's Mansion.The building is just beautiful, located across the street from the famous Painted Ladies (Victorian homes) and Alamo Square Park. The location is unbeatable (a 5-10 minute max drive from most anywhere in the city). The mansion has its own small parking lot, and street parking can be located quickly -- for me, this is key when booking a hotel in SFO, where finding parking can be a frustrating chore and some hotels charge ridiculous daily parking rates.The staff really shined. It was my birthday and they were always saying happy birthday, and asking us if we were enjoying ourselves. A tiny little touch like this that you won't find in a mainstream hotel can make a world of difference. Our room (named Romeo and Juliet) was appointed with antique furniture, beautiful wallpaper, and a canopied bed. It also had an enormous tub with a sitting area in the bathroom. The room was surprisingly quiet, although we were told that the place was full. A very good expanded continental breakfast of our choosing was delivered to our room each morning on a silver tray at our requested time. In closing, I would just like to weigh in on a few prior negative comments appearing in reviews below. First, none of the staff, including the manager, were condescending. Although I cannot vouch for others' perceptions, as stated above, the staff were at all times excellent to us. Second, I did not smell mold. The property was impeccably clean. Finally, the neighborhood in which the AB is located is very upscale, and we had no problems walking around at night, including in Alamo Square.In sum, we had a spectacular time and we'll be back.
Reviews.Author: ChristopherPrusaski

Reviews.Content: Romantic I would recommend this hotel for a romantic stay. Tosca (with its red color and fireplace) and Don Giovanni (with the parlor opened) are very romantic rooms. I would remind you though that there can be traffic noise heard. But then, this is the city. But if you want a romantic getaway in the city, this is the place for you.
Reviews.Author: tadcali

Reviews.Content: Fabulous Stay! We stayed in the Carmen suite for two nights and loved it! The mansion is beautiful inside and out, with amazing woodwork and lush decorations. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The staff at the Archbishop's Mansion was friendly and helpful. Many of the San Francisco tourist attractions (Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square) are quite a ways away; but with the staff's help and suggestions, we had no problem getting around. We took advantage of the Archbishop's free parking and used SF public transportation, which was very easy to navigate. I would recommend buying a Muni pass if you plan on using public transport, because they are inexpensive ($6/day) and cover buses and cable cars.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Unpleasantly surprised I planned this romantic getaway because my husband had been in Iraq and we needed some time together, so I had seen all of the wonderful reviews and thought this would be great! The moment we got to the hotel my husband and I just looked at each other and we know immediately what we were thinking. The place smelled like old mold. We could not stand it. The staff was pleasant but I would have to say that the manager was very condisending as noted in one of the other reviews. It reminded us of a spokey mansion, we decided to leave for another hotel after we went out for lunch just 3 blocks down the road the neighborhood did not seem safe. We may have been paranoid but decided quickly to get out of there. We ended up going to Hilton, it was cheaper and smelled much nicer. Sorry, but this was not my idea of romance. Don't get fooled, I was and ended up paying for two nights at 200.00 a night and didn't even stay there once. Beware!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Outstanding Staff... The staff at The Archbishop's Mansion went above and beyond basic service. Friendly, warm and extremely knowledgable. Perfect driving directions and great restaurant suggestions. The Mansion is jaw-droppingly gorgeous and my room (Der Rosenkavalier) was electically elegant (the huge bathroom has a Victorian sofa near the tub). The only thing that kept me from rating this hotel as excellent was the old smell when I first walked in the room...the musty/musky smell of old/antique furniture...which dissipated after a few minutes. Overall: elegant and exquisite and one of the best staffs in the world!
Reviews.Author: 1tallcool1

Reviews.Content: A gem with so much class My wife and I just came back from our short trip to the city. The Mansion was wonderful. People were very helpful, making reservations and helping us get around. Small, cozy room met all of our needs. We'll be back.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Unpleasant. The manager was very condescending, and I'm a nice, easy-going guy--honestly. I will never return.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nothing but exceptional ! we spent a day or two at hotel rex which was great! after that we went to archbishop's mansion for two days. we stayed in the 'tosca'-room which was beautiful and super romantic! 3. we were in san francisco for our wedding and we cant say enough about how well cared for we were by the staff at the archbishop's.john, the manager, went above and beyond what we had expected. when it was suggested a special flower-arrangement be obtained, he said 'no problem' and it was done.when we suggested or needed other idems, they were there, almost immedeately.because of the archbishop's our stay in san francisco was fantastic and our special day will always be connected with this wonderful place and experience.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: wonderful, but expensive (rates change very frequently) Possibly my favourite hotel in San Francisco - unique, historical, fabulous place.Location isn't that great for walking around, but cabs are everywhere.Be very very careful when you book, as their rates change very frequently, and the last time I stayed there, they changed the rate from what I booked it under - from 160 to almost 300, and were terribly inflexible about working with me on it.All in all, truly a fantastic place though.
Reviews.Author: KevinSdammit

Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience We recently stayed in the Cosi Fan Tutte suite for 2 nights and had an exceptional time. Mark was very helpful in all of his suggestions and recommendations from a small neighborhood cafe for a quick lunch to a splendid dinner out. He really went above and beyond. Also, Heather and John made sure that our stay was all that we hoped for. The suite was perfect for our needs as we needed to stay in during the day. I had the opportunity to see into several of their other rooms and did not see any that could not be described as spectacular. We opted to stay elsewhere for our last night but regretted the decision once we had already moved. The Archbishop's Mansion will always be our first choice when we return to San Francisco! Location has easy access to almost anything in the city.
Reviews.Author: landylady

Reviews.Content: Loved the Archbishop Mansion I stayed here when attending a friend's wedding. Only one night and wish I could have stayed longer. We were automatically upgraded into an extremely large suite, for the same price, upon check-in. Very nice touch. The place is absolutely beautiful and I only wish we could have stayed longer. The staff was very helpful and directed us to a terrific little neighborhood jazz club right down the street, which we loved and had a great time in. I only wish we could have stayed longer! The only negative aspect (very small) was not much parking. Someone parked behind us during the night, making it almost impossible for us to get the car out of the tiny parking lot. We literally had to ask the desk clerk to come out and stand there guiding us while we pulled backward, forward, backward etc. for about 20 minutes before we could nose the car around the one behind us. Other than that, however, the hotel, staff and experience was terrific!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: History, antiques, charm The Archbishop's Mansion is located in an amazing and historic neighborhood where many of the Painted Ladies (original and ornately painted Victorian row houses). The area is a bit quitet and a bit of a walk from tourist attractions, but the area is beautiful and there is a large park nearby.Upon entering this wonderful hotel, you immediately feel like an invited guest rather than a customer. The place reeks of history and is filled with period antiques, many of which have their own stories.We ended up in one of the smaller rooms, but the suites in this hotel are typically huge and extremely well appointed.Breakfast is included and is your typical free breakfast complete with Lender's bagels and Dannon yogurt, but the setting of the dining room is what is most appealing. Again, you are make to feel like an honored guest, seated at the huge dining table.This hotel is definitely worth a try. Often there some good deals to be found. The Joie De Vivre chain will beat any price you can find on the internet if you call them or the hotel directly.
Reviews.Author: gregjarvis

Reviews.Content: Not bad, but not awesome We stayed in Don Giovanni. Employers were nice overall. But they forgot to prepare our breakfast even though we called them at night the day before. So we had to change our plan a bit because breakfast arrived much later than we thought. Besides, there was a cleaning stuff left at window, which destroyed the whole atmosphere of the gorgeous suite. A peg was also left on the floor, with which my feet almost got hurt.There are two bathrooms and one was dirty with blue marks. So we did not want to use it. The place of the Mansion is a bit way off from downtown and is not located in a convenient and nice place. Free parking is great, though.We will probably not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Thanks for the Memories! We recently celebrated our 17th wedding anniversary at the Archbishop's Mansion in San Francisco. Our wonderful night in the Cosi Fan Tutte suite continued our tradition of staying at the Mansion every year since our wedding night in 1987. We had the privilege of experiencing all 15 unique guest rooms over the years, so now it feels like our second home.The Don Giovanni suite is very elegant, if you can afford the splurge. The salon attached to it is large enough to hold a cocktail party, so invite your friends to drop by if you book this suite. La Tosca is our favorite of the mid-priced non-suites, but whatever room you choose, you will have a thoroughly memorable stay.When family and friends visit San Francisco, we always recommend the Archbishop's Mansion as the most luxurious romantic inn. We look forward to being their guests again next year!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
